intro: Curatella grisebachiana, commonly known as the gray curatella, is a flowering plant species native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are often clustered in inflorescences and are surrounded by colorful bracts, which can vary in hue depending on the species. Curatella grisebachiana is also notable for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies.
